\subparagraph{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.checkdigit.checkdigit module}
\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines.checkdigit:module-apache_commons_validator_python.routines.checkdigit.checkdigit}}\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines.checkdigit:apache-commons-validator-python-routines-checkdigit-checkdigit-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.checkdigit.checkdigit@\spxentry{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.checkdigit.checkdigit}}\index{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.checkdigit.checkdigit@\spxentry{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.checkdigit.checkdigit}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Module Name: checkdigit.py
Description: Translates apache.commons.validator.routines.checkdigit.CheckDigit.java
Link: \sphinxurl{https://github.com/apache/commons-validator/blob/master/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/checkdigit/CheckDigit.java}
Paraphrased from apache.commons.validator.routines.checkdigit.CheckDigit.java:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Check Digit calculation and validation.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The logic for validating check digits was previously embedded within specific
code validation, which included format and length verification. The \sphinxtitleref{CheckDigit}
class separates the check digit calculation logic, making it easier to test and reuse.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Although Commons Validator primarily focuses on validation, \sphinxtitleref{CheckDigit} also defines
behavior for calculating and generating check digits. This allows users to reuse the same
logic for both validation and generation. For example, validator.routines.ISBNValidator
makes specific use of this feature by providing the facility to validate
ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}10 codes and then converting them to the new ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}13 standard.

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{CheckDigit} is used by the generic \sphinxtitleref{CodeValidator} implementation.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Implementations:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
See the package summary for a full list of implementations provided within Commons Validator.

\end{description}
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Author: Juji Lau
License (Taken from apache.commons.validator.routines.checkdigit.CheckDigit.java):
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.checkdigit.checkdigit.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{CheckDigit}}}

Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ABC}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Check Digit calculation and validation.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The logic for validating check digits was previously embedded within specific
code validation, which included format and length verification. The \sphinxtitleref{CheckDigit}
class separates the check digit calculation logic, making it easier to test and reuse.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Although Commons Validator primarily focuses on validation, \sphinxtitleref{CheckDigit} also defines
behavior for calculating and generating check digits. This allows users to reuse the same
logic for both validation and generation. For example, validator.routines.ISBNValidator
makes specific use of this feature by providing the facility to validate
ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}10 codes and then converting them to the new ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}13 standard.

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{CheckDigit} is used by the generic \sphinxtitleref{CodeValidator} implementation.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Modulus 10 EAN\sphinxhyphen{}13 UPC ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}13 Check Digit calculation/validation.

\subparagraph{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.checkdigit.isbn10\_checkdigit module}
\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines.checkdigit:module-apache_commons_validator_python.routines.checkdigit.isbn10_checkdigit}}\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines.checkdigit:apache-commons-validator-python-routines-checkdigit-isbn10-checkdigit-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.checkdigit.isbn10\_checkdigit@\spxentry{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.checkdigit.isbn10\_checkdigit}}\index{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.checkdigit.isbn10\_checkdigit@\spxentry{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.checkdigit.isbn10\_checkdigit}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Module Name: isbn10\_checkdigit.py
Description: Translates apache.commons.validator.routines.checkdigit.ISBN10CheckDigit.java
Link: \sphinxurl{https://github.com/apache/commons-validator/blob/master/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/checkdigit/ISBN10CheckDigit.java}
Parapphrased from apache.commons.validator.routines.checkdigit.ISBN10CheckDigit.java:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Modulus 11 ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}10 Check Digit calculation/validation.
ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}10 Numbers are a numeric code except for the last (check) digit which can have a value of “X”.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Check digit calculation is based on modulus 11 with digits being weighted based by their position,
from right to left  with the first digit being weighted 1, the second 2 and so on.
If the check digit is calculated as “10” it is converted to “X”.

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{NOTE:}
From 1st January 2007 the book industry will start to use a new 13 digit ISBN number
(rather than this 10 digit ISBN number) which uses the EAN\sphinxhyphen{}13 / UPC standard (see EAN13CheckDigit).
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{For further information see:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{Wikipedia \sphinxhyphen{} ISBN \textless{}https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISBN\textgreater{}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\color{red}\bfseries{}\textasciigrave{}}ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}13 Transition Details \textless{}\sphinxurl{http://www.isbn.org/standards/home/isbn/transition.asp}\textgreater{}

\end{itemize}

\end{description}
\end{quote}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines.checkdigit:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.checkdigit.isin_checkdigit.ISINCheckDigit}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.checkdigit.isin\_checkdigit.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ISINCheckDigit}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ModulusCheckDigit}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Modulus 10 ISIN (International Securities Identifying Number) Check Digit
calculation and validation.

\sphinxAtStartPar
ISINs are 12\sphinxhyphen{}character alphanumeric identifiers used for securities.
This validator uses the Modulus 10 Double Add Double method:
\sphinxhyphen{} Every second digit is weighted by 2, starting from the right.
\sphinxhyphen{} Alphabetic characters are converted to values: A=10, B=11, …, Z=35.
\sphinxhyphen{} Weighted digits over 9 are split and summed (e.g., 18 \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} 1 + 8 = 9).

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines.checkdigit:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.checkdigit.luhn_checkdigit.LuhnCheckDigit}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.checkdigit.luhn\_checkdigit.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{LuhnCheckDigit}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ModulusCheckDigit}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class is used to validate check digits using the Luhn (modulus 10) algorithm,
which is commonly applied to credit card numbers and other identification numbers.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The Luhn algorithm weights digits from right to left, doubling every
second digit and subtracting 9 if the result exceeds 9. This helps detect
common data entry errors such as transpositions and single\sphinxhyphen{}digit mistakes.
\index{LUHN\_CHECK\_DIGIT (apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.checkdigit.luhn\_checkdigit.LuhnCheckDigit attribute)@\spxentry{LUHN\_CHECK\_DIGIT}\spxextra{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.checkdigit.luhn\_checkdigit.LuhnCheckDigit attribute}}

\subparagraph{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.checkdigit.modulus\_checkdigit module}

Module Name: modulus\_checkdigit.py
Description: Translates apache.commons.validator.routines.checkdigit.ModulusCheckDigit.java
Link: \sphinxurl{https://github.com/apache/commons-validator/blob/master/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/checkdigit/ModulusCheckDigit.java}
Parapphrased from apache.commons.validator.routines.checkdigit.ModulusCheckDigit.java:
\begin{quote}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Abstract Modulus Check digit calculation/validation:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Provides a base class for building Modulus Check Digit routines.
This implementation only handles single\sphinxhyphen{}digit numeric codes, such as EAN\sphinxhyphen{}13.
For alphanumeric codes such as EAN\sphinxhyphen{}128 you will need to implement/override the \sphinxtitleref{toInt()} and \sphinxtitleref{toChar()} methods.

\end{description}
\end{quote}

\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Changes:}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{In ModulusCheckDigit.\_to\_int() for the argument, \sphinxtitleref{final char character}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
I accept a Python str of len(1) in the place of Java’s char.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Python does not support single characters

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
I raise a ValueError exception via CheckDigitException if the input is not a string of length 1.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\end{description}

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AbstractCheckDigit}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Abstract base class for Modulus Check Digit calculation and validation.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class provides a foundation for implementing modulus\sphinxhyphen{}based check digit routines.
It supports single\sphinxhyphen{}digit numeric codes like EAN\sphinxhyphen{}13. For alphanumeric codes (e.g., EAN\sphinxhyphen{}128)
override the \sphinxtitleref{\_to\_int()} and \sphinxtitleref{\_to\_char()} methods.

\sphinxlineitem{Changes:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Removed Java’s Calendar fields that don’t have an equivalent datetime field.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Modified \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AbstractCalendarValidator.compare(Calendar value, Calendar compare, int field)}} have users pass in a string
instead of an int. Python’s datetime validator does not map its properties to integers, hence using integers will be confusing
to Python users.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Implemented \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{parse()}} in the concrete subclasses instead.

\end{description}

\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{format}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{o}{*}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{value}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{object}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{pattern}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{locale}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{p}{|}\DUrole{w}{ }Locale}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{time\_zone}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{timezone}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ str}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Format an object into a string using the specified pattern and/or locale.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{value}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{object}}) \textendash{} The value validation is being performed on.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pattern}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The pattern used to format the value.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{locale}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} A locale string (e.g., “en\_US”) used for formatting.
If locale is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}} or empty, the system default is used.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{time\_zone}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{timezone}}) \textendash{} The timezone used to format the date,
If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}}, the system default will be used unless value is a \sphinxtitleref{datetime}.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The value formatted as a String.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.abstract_number_validator.AbstractNumberValidator}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.abstract\_number\_validator.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{AbstractNumberValidator}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{strict}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{bool}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{format\_type}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{int}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{allow\_fractions}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{bool}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.abstract_format_validator.AbstractFormatValidator}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AbstractFormatValidator}}}}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Abstract base class for Number Validation.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This is a base class for building Number Validators.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Once a value has been successfully converted the following methods can be used
to perform minimum, maximum and range checks:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
min\_value() checks whether the value is greater than or equal to a specified minimum.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
max\_value() checks whether the value is less than or equal to a specified maximum.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
is\_in\_range() checks whether the value is within a specified range of values.

\end{itemize}

\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.big\_decimal\_validator.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{BigDecimalValidator}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{strict}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{bool}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{True}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{format\_type}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{int}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{0}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{allow\_fractions}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{bool}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{True}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.abstract_number_validator.AbstractNumberValidator}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AbstractNumberValidator}}}}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
BigDecimal Validation and Conversion routines.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This validator provides a number of methods for validating/converting a string value
to a big decimal to parse either:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for a specified locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with a specified locale.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Use the is\_valid() method to just validate or one of the validate() methods to
validate and receive a converted big decimal value.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Fraction/decimal values are automatically rounded to the appropriate length.

\sphinxAtStartPar
So that the same mechanism used for parsing an input value for validation can be used to format output,
corresponding format() methods are also provided. That is you can format either:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for a specified locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with a specified locale.

\end{itemize}
\index{get\_instance() (apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.big\_decimal\_validator.BigDecimalValidator class method)@\spxentry{get\_instance()}\spxextra{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.big\_decimal\_validator.BigDecimalValidator class method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstartsignatures

\pysigstopsignatures

\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{validate() (apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.big\_decimal\_validator.BigDecimalValidator method)@\spxentry{validate()}\spxextra{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.big\_decimal\_validator.BigDecimalValidator method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

Validate/convert a big decimal using the optional pattern and/or locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxAtStartPar
Byte Validation and Conversion routines.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This validator provides a number of methods for validating/converting a string value
to a byte to parse either:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for a specified locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with a specified locale.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Use the is\_valid() method to just validate or one of the validate() methods to
validate and receive a converted byte value.

\sphinxAtStartPar
So that the same mechanism used for parsing an input value for validation can be used to format output,
corresponding format() methods are also provided. That is you can format either:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for a specified locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with a specified locale.

\end{itemize}

Module Name: calendar\_validator.py

\sphinxAtStartPar
Description: Translates apache.commons.validator.routines.CalendarValidator.java
Link: \sphinxurl{https://github.com/apache/commons-validator/blob/master/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/CalendarValidator.java}
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This file is meant to translate Java’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Calendar}} class.  However, since Python’s
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{datetime.datetime}} class is much more closely functional to Java’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Calendar}} class, this
file will be validating Python’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{datetime.datetime}} class.
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AbstractCalendarValidator}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Calendar Validation and Conversion Routines (using Python datetime objects)

\sphinxAtStartPar
This module provides a collection of methods for validating and converting a
string representing a date and/or time into a Python datetime (or date/time)
object. Parsing can be performed using various mechanisms:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Using the default format for the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Using a specified pattern with the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Using the default format for a specified locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Using a specified pattern with a specified locale.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
For each of the above mechanisms, validation function implementations are provided
which either use the system’s default timezone or allow a timezone to be explicitly specified.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Usage:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Use one of the is\_valid() methods to simply check if a given string is valid.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Use one of the validate() methods to both validate the input and return a

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
converted datetime (or date/time) object.

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Additionally, methods are provided to create datetime objects adjusted for
different time zones if the system default is not appropriate. Alternatively,
the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{adjust\_to\_timezone()}} method can be used to modify the timezone of an
existing \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{datetime}} object.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Once a value has been successfully converted, several comparison methods are
available to perform date arithmetic and comparison checks:
\begin{quote}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
compare\_dates(): Compares the day, month, and year of two datetime objects.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
compare\_weeks(): Compares the week and year of two datetime objects.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
compare\_months(): Compares the month and year of two datetime objects.

\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{compare\_quarters(): Compares the quarter (computed from the month) and year}
\sphinxAtStartPar
of two datetime objects.

\end{description}

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
These compare methods return 0 if the arguments are equal, \sphinxhyphen{}1 if the first
argument is earlier, or +1 if it is later.
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
To allow the same parsing mechanism used for input validation to be
used for output formatting, corresponding format() methods are provided. These
methods enable formatting of datetime objects by:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Using a specified pattern.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Using the format for a specified locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Using the format for the default locale.

\end{itemize}

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Compare Years.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{value}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{datetime}}) \textendash{} The datetime value to check.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{compare}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{datetime}}) \textendash{} The datetime to compare the value to.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
0 if the years are equal,
\sphinxhyphen{}1 if the first year is less than the second.
+1 if the first year is greater than the second.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

Module Name: code\_validator.py
Description: Translates apache.commons.validator.routines.CodeValidator.java
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Link: \sphinxurl{https://github.com/apache/commons-validator/blob/master/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/CodeValidator.java}
Paraphrased from apache.commons.validator.routines.CodeValidator:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class provides generic Code Validation, providing format, minimum/maximum length,
and check digit validations.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{This class performs the following validations on a code:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
If the code is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}}, return \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}}/\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{False}} as appropriate.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Trim the input. If the resulting code is empty, return \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}}/\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{False}} as appropriate.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check the \sphinxstyleemphasis{format} of the code using a \sphinxstyleemphasis{regular expression} (if specified).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check the \sphinxstyleemphasis{minimum} and \sphinxstyleemphasis{maximum} length (if specified) of the \sphinxstyleemphasis{parsed} code
(that is, parsed by the \sphinxstyleemphasis{regular expression}).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Perform \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{CheckDigit}} validation on the parsed code (if specified).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{validate()}} method returns the trimmed, parsed input (or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}} if validation failed).

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Note:}
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{is\_valid()}} method will return \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}} if the input passes validation.
Since this includes trimming as well as potentially dropping parts of the input,
it is possible for a string to pass validation but fail the check digit test
if passed directly to it. Check digit routines generally don’t trim input
nor do they check the format/length.

\sphinxAtStartPar
To ensure valid input is passed to a method, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{validate()}} as follows:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{valid} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{validator}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{validate}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{input}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{valid} \PYG{o+ow}{is} \PYG{o+ow}{not} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{some\PYGZus{}method}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{valid}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The validator should be configured with the appropriate regular expression,
minimum/maximum length, and check digit validator before calling one of the two
validation methods:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{is\_valid()}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{validate()}}

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Codes often include \sphinxstyleemphasis{format} characters—such as hyphens—to improve human readability.
These can be removed prior to length and check digit validation by specifying them as
a \sphinxstyleemphasis{non\sphinxhyphen{}capturing} group in the regular expression (i.e., using the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{(?:   )}} notation).

\sphinxAtStartPar
Alternatively, avoid using parentheses except for the parts you want to capture.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{since}
\sphinxAtStartPar
1.4

\end{description}\end{quote}
\end{quote}
\end{quote}

Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class performs generic code validation, including format checks using
regular expressions, minimum/maximum length validation, and check digit validation.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{It ensures that:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
If the input code is \sphinxtitleref{None}, returns \sphinxtitleref{None}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
It trims the input code and checks if the result is non\sphinxhyphen{}empty.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
It validates the code format using a regular expression (if specified).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
It checks the minimum and maximum length of the code (if specified).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
It optionally performs check digit validation.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\sphinxlineitem{Changes:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
In Java, the CreditCardValidator class has multiple overloaded constructors but
, in Python, all that flexibility is handled in a single \_\_init\_\_ method.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Validates credit card numbers based on known issuer patterns, numeric format, and
Luhn check digit rules.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class supports multiple built\sphinxhyphen{}in credit card types such as Visa, MasterCard,
American Express, Discover, Diners, and VPay. It can also be configured with
custom validation rules, either through regular expressions or prefix\sphinxhyphen{}based
range validation.

\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Usage:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Use the default constructor to validate common card types.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Use \sphinxtitleref{generic\_credit\_card\_validator()} to validate any numeric card
number within a length range using only Luhn check.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Extend with custom \sphinxtitleref{CodeValidator} or range\sphinxhyphen{}based validators for
specialized card types.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Represents a credit card number range for validating issuer prefix (IIN) and
permissible card number lengths.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Used to define card validation logic for ranges like:
\sphinxhyphen{} ‘400000’ to ‘499999’ for Visa
\sphinxhyphen{} ‘510000’ to ‘559999’ for older MasterCard prefixes

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{CurrencyValidator (class in apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.currency\_validator)@\spxentry{CurrencyValidator}\spxextra{class in apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.currency\_validator}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.currency_validator.CurrencyValidator}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.currency\_validator.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{CurrencyValidator}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{strict}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{bool}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{True}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{allow\_fractions}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{bool}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{True}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.big_decimal_validator.BigDecimalValidator}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{BigDecimalValidator}}}}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Currency Validation and Conversion routines.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{This is one implementation of a currency validator that has the following features:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
It is lenient about the presence of the currency symbol.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
It converts the currency to a float.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Use the is\_valid() method to just validate or one of the validate() methods to
validate and receive a converted big decimal value.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Fraction/decimal values are automatically rounded to the appropriate length.

\sphinxAtStartPar
So that the same mechanism used for parsing an input value for validation can be used to format output,
corresponding format() methods are also provided. That is you can format either:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for a specified locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with a specified locale.

\end{itemize}
\index{get\_instance() (apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.currency\_validator.CurrencyValidator class method)@\spxentry{get\_instance()}\spxextra{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.currency\_validator.CurrencyValidator class method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.currency_validator.CurrencyValidator.get_instance}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{classmethod\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_instance}}}{}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Gets the singleton instance of this validator.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A singleton instance of the validator.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AbstractCalendarValidator}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Date validation and conversion utilities.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This module provides methods to validate and convert string representations
of dates into timezone naive \sphinxtitleref{datetime.datetime} objects using various parsing formats and locales.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Supported conversions:
\sphinxhyphen{} Default format for the default locale
\sphinxhyphen{} Specified pattern with the default locale
\sphinxhyphen{} Default format for a specified locale
\sphinxhyphen{} Specified pattern with a specified locale

\sphinxAtStartPar
All conversion methods allow optional specification of time zones.
If this is not provided, the system default will be used.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Validation methods:
\sphinxhyphen{} \sphinxtitleref{is\_valid()}: Checks if a string is a valid date.
\sphinxhyphen{} \sphinxtitleref{validate()}: Returns a converted \sphinxtitleref{date} object if valid.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Date comparison methods:
\sphinxhyphen{} \sphinxtitleref{compare\_dates(d1, d2)}: Compares day, month, year of two dates.
\sphinxhyphen{} \sphinxtitleref{compare\_weeks(d1, d2)}: Compares week and year of two dates.
\sphinxhyphen{} \sphinxtitleref{compare\_months(d1, d2)}: Compares month and year of two dates.
\sphinxhyphen{} \sphinxtitleref{compare\_quarters(d1, d2)}: Compares quarter and year of two dates.
\sphinxhyphen{} \sphinxtitleref{compare\_years(d1, d2)}: Compares years of two dates.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Formatting methods mirror parsing options and support:
\sphinxhyphen{} Specified pattern
\sphinxhyphen{} Format for a specified locale
\sphinxhyphen{} Format for the default locale

Compare two datetime values by day, month, and year (ignores time component).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{value}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{datetime}}) \textendash{} The first datetime to compare.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{compare}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{datetime}}) \textendash{} The second datetime to compare against.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{time\_zone}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tzinfo}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}) \textendash{} Optional time zone to align both values before comparison.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
0 if the dates are equal,
\sphinxhyphen{}1 if the first date is earlier,
+1 if the first date is later.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
int

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.date_validator.DateValidator.validate}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{validate}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{value}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{pattern}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{p}{|}\DUrole{w}{ }None}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{locale}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{p}{|}\DUrole{w}{ }None}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{time\_zone}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{tzinfo\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{p}{|}\DUrole{w}{ }None}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ datetime\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{p}{|}\DUrole{w}{ }None}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Validates and converts a date string into a datetime object using the
provided pattern, locale, and time zone.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{value}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The input string to validate.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pattern}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}) \textendash{} The date pattern (e.g., ‘yyyy\sphinxhyphen{}MM\sphinxhyphen{}dd’). If None, a default pattern is used.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{locale}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}) \textendash{} The locale to apply (e.g., ‘en\_US’). If None, the system default is used.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{time\_zone}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tzinfo}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}) \textendash{} The timezone to apply to the resulting datetime. If None, no change is made.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A valid datetime object if parsing succeeds, or None if invalid.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Optional{[}datetime{]}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.domain\_validator.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{DomainValidator}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{o}{*}\DUrole{n}{args}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{o}{**}\DUrole{n}{kwargs}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Domain name validation routines.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This validator provides methods for validating Internet domain names
and top\sphinxhyphen{}level domains.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Domain names are evaluated according to the standards of RFC1034 section 3 and RFC1123 section 2.1.
No accommodation is provided for the specialized needs of other applications;
if the domain name has been URL\sphinxhyphen{}encoded, for example, validation will fail
even though the equivalent plaintext version of the same name would have passed.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Validation is also provided for top\sphinxhyphen{}level domains (TLDs) as defined and
maintained by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA):
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
is\_valid\_infrastructure\_tld(): validates infrastructure TLDs (.arpa, etc.).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
is\_valid\_generic\_tld(): validates generic TLDs (.com, .org, etc.).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
is\_valid\_country\_code\_tld(): validates country code TLDs (.us, .uk, .cn, etc.).

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
(NOTE: This class does not provide IP address lookup for domain names or
methods to ensure that a given domain name matches a specific IP;
see inet\_address\_validator.py for that functionality.)

\index{get\_instance() (apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.domain\_validator.DomainValidator class method)@\spxentry{get\_instance()}\spxextra{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.domain\_validator.DomainValidator class method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.domain_validator.DomainValidator.get_instance}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{classmethod\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_instance}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{allow\_local}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{bool}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{False}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{items}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns the singleton instance of this validator, with local validation if
required (not by default). The user can provide a list of Item entries which can
be used to override the generic and country code lists. Note that any such
entries override values provided by the update\_tld\_override(ArrayType, str)
method. If an entry for a particular type is not provided, then the class
override (if any) is retained.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{allow\_local}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} If local addresses be considered valid.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{items}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}{\hyperref[\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.domain_validator.DomainValidator.Item}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Item}}}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}) \textendash{} List of Item entries.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The singleton instance of this validator.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{is\_valid() (apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.domain\_validator.DomainValidator method)@\spxentry{is\_valid()}\spxextra{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.domain\_validator.DomainValidator method}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns \sphinxtitleref{True} if the specified domain parses as a valid domain name
with a recognized top\sphinxhyphen{}level domain. The parsing is case\sphinxhyphen{}insensitive.

\begin{fulllineitems}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns \sphinxtitleref{True} if the specified string matches any IANA\sphinxhyphen{}defined top\sphinxhyphen{}level
domain. Leading dots are ignored if present. The search is case\sphinxhyphen{}insensitive.

\sphinxAtStartPar
If allow\_local is \sphinxtitleref{True}, the TLD is checked using is\_valid\_local\_tld(str). The
TLD is then checked against is\_valid\_infrastructure\_tld(str),
is\_valid\_generic\_tld(str) and is\_valid\_country\_code\_tld(str).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{True} if the parameter is a TLD.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{update\_tld\_override() (apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.domain\_validator.DomainValidator static method)@\spxentry{update\_tld\_override()}\spxextra{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.domain\_validator.DomainValidator static method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.domain_validator.DomainValidator.update_tld_override}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{static\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{update\_tld\_override}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{table}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{{\hyperref[\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.domain_validator.DomainValidator.ArrayType}]{\sphinxcrossref{ArrayType}}}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{tlds}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{list\DUrole{p}{{[}}str\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Update one of the TLD override arrays. This must only be done at program
startup, before any instances are accessed using get\_instance.

\sphinxAtStartPar
For example:
updateTLDOverride(ArrayType.GENERIC\_PLUS, “apache”)
To clear an override list, provide an empty list.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{table}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.domain_validator.DomainValidator.ArrayType}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ArrayType}}}}}) \textendash{} The table to update, see ArrayType. Must be one of the following:
\sphinxhyphen{} COUNTRY\_CODE\_MINUS
\sphinxhyphen{} COUNTRY\_CODE\_PLUS
\sphinxhyphen{} GENERIC\_MINUS
\sphinxhyphen{} GENERIC\_PLUS
\sphinxhyphen{} LOCAL\_MINUS
\sphinxhyphen{} LOCAL\_PLUS

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{tlds}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}) \textendash{} The list of TLDs, must not be \sphinxtitleref{None}.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Throws an \sphinxtitleref{Exception} if the validator is in use.
Throws a \sphinxtitleref{ValueError} if one of the read\sphinxhyphen{}only tables is requested.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\index{DoubleValidator (class in apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.double\_validator)@\spxentry{DoubleValidator}\spxextra{class in apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.double\_validator}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.double_validator.DoubleValidator}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.double\_validator.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{DoubleValidator}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{strict}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{bool}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{True}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{format\_type}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{int}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{0}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.abstract_number_validator.AbstractNumberValidator}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AbstractNumberValidator}}}}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Double Validation and Conversion routines.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This validator provides a number of methods for validating/converting a string value
to a double to parse either:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for a specified locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with a specified locale.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Use the is\_valid() method to just validate or one of the validate() methods to
validate and receive a converted double value.

\sphinxAtStartPar
So that the same mechanism used for parsing an input value for validation can be used to format output,
corresponding format() methods are also provided. That is you can format either:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for a specified locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with a specified locale.

\end{itemize}
\index{get\_instance() (apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.double\_validator.DoubleValidator class method)@\spxentry{get\_instance()}\spxextra{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.double\_validator.DoubleValidator class method}}

\pysigstopsignatures

Validate/convert a double using the optional pattern and/or locale.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{value}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The value validation is being performed on.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pattern}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The (optional) regex pattern used to validate the value against,
or the default for the locale if \sphinxtitleref{None}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{locale}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The (optional) locale to use for the format, defaults to the system default.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The parsed double (as a float) if valid or \sphinxtitleref{None} if invalid.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.float_validator.FloatValidator}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.float\_validator.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{FloatValidator}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{strict}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{bool}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{True}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{format\_type}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{int}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{0}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.abstract_number_validator.AbstractNumberValidator}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AbstractNumberValidator}}}}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Float Validation and Conversion routines.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This validator provides a number of methods for validating/converting a string value
to a float to parse either:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for a specified locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with a specified locale.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Use the is\_valid() method to just validate or one of the validate() methods to
validate and receive a converted float value.

\sphinxAtStartPar
So that the same mechanism used for parsing an input value for validation can be used to format output,
corresponding format() methods are also provided. That is you can format either:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for a specified locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with a specified locale.

\end{itemize}

Validate/convert a float using the optional pattern and/or locale.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{value}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The value validation is being performed on.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pattern}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The (optional) regex pattern used to validate the value against,
or the default for the locale if \sphinxtitleref{None}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{locale}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The (optional) locale to use for the format, defaults to the system default.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The parsed float if valid or \sphinxtitleref{None} if invalid.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Integer Validation and Conversion routines.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This validator provides a number of methods for validating/converting a string value
to an integer to parse either:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for a specified locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with a specified locale.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Use the is\_valid() method to just validate or one of the validate() methods to
validate and receive a converted int value.

\sphinxAtStartPar
So that the same mechanism used for parsing an input value for validation can be used to format output,
corresponding format() methods are also provided. That is you can format either:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for a specified locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with a specified locale.

\end{itemize}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\paragraph{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.isbn\_validator module}
\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:module-apache_commons_validator_python.routines.isbn_validator}}\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache-commons-validator-python-routines-isbn-validator-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.isbn\_validator@\spxentry{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.isbn\_validator}}\index{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.isbn\_validator@\spxentry{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.isbn\_validator}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Module Name: isbn\_validator.py
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Description:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Translates apache.commons.validator.routines.ISBNValidator.java
This module provides a class \sphinxtitleref{ISBNValidator} for validating ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}10 and ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}13 codes.
It also supports converting ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}10 codes to ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}13 if the \sphinxtitleref{convert} attribute is set to \sphinxtitleref{fov}.
The class uses regular expressions to validate the formats and check digits for ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}10 and ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}13 codes.
It also allows ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}10 codes to be converted to ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}13 using specific conversion logic.

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Link: \sphinxurl{https://github.com/apache/commons-validator/blob/master/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/ISBNValidator.java}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Author: Juji Lau
\begin{description}

\sphinxlineitem{Changes:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Removed \sphinxtitleref{getInstance()} method, which supports singleton behavior in the Java version. Singleton behavior is implicit in this Python version.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Added a setter for the \sphinxtitleref{convert} property. In the original Java version, \sphinxtitleref{getInstance(convert)} provided a way to configure this, but it has been replaced with a direct attribute.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
removed ISBN\_VALIDATOR and ISBN\_VALIDATOR\_NO\_CONVERT from the java version (idk how to implement)

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
A validator class for ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}10 and ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}13 codes.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class validates whether a code is a valid ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}10 or ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}13 and provides the ability
to convert ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}10 codes to ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}13 if the \sphinxtitleref{convert} property is set to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}}.

SEP (str): The separator used in ISBN code formats (either hyphens or spaces).
GROUP (str): Regular expression pattern for the group portion of the ISBN code.
PUBLISHER (str): Regular expression pattern for the publisher portion of the ISBN code.
TITLE (str): Regular expression pattern for the title portion of the ISBN code.
ISBN10\_REGEX (str): Regular expression pattern for ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}10 validation.
ISBN13\_REGEX (str): Regular expression pattern for ISBN\sphinxhyphen{}13 validation.

\index{LongValidator (class in apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.long\_validator)@\spxentry{LongValidator}\spxextra{class in apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.long\_validator}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.long_validator.LongValidator}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.long\_validator.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{LongValidator}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{strict}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{bool}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{True}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{format\_type}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{int}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{0}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.abstract_number_validator.AbstractNumberValidator}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AbstractNumberValidator}}}}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Long Validation and Conversion routines.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This validator provides a number of methods for validating/converting a string value
to a long to parse either:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for a specified locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with a specified locale.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Use the is\_valid() method to just validate or one of the validate() methods to
validate and receive a converted long value.

\sphinxAtStartPar
So that the same mechanism used for parsing an input value for validation can be used to format output,
corresponding format() methods are also provided. That is you can format either:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for a specified locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with a specified locale.

\end{itemize}
\index{LONG\_MIN (apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.long\_validator.LongValidator attribute)@\spxentry{LONG\_MIN}\spxextra{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.long\_validator.LongValidator attribute}}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\index{PercentValidator (class in apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.percent\_validator)@\spxentry{PercentValidator}\spxextra{class in apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.percent\_validator}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.percent_validator.PercentValidator}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.percent\_validator.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{PercentValidator}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{strict}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{bool}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{True}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.big_decimal_validator.BigDecimalValidator}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{BigDecimalValidator}}}}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Percent Validation and Conversion routines.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{This is one implementation of a percent validator that has the following features:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
It is lenient about the presence of the currency symbol.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
It converts the percent to a float.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Use the is\_valid() method to just validate or one of the validate() methods to
validate and receive a converted big decimal value.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Fraction/decimal values are automatically rounded to the appropriate length.

\sphinxAtStartPar
So that the same mechanism used for parsing an input value for validation can be used to format output,
corresponding format() methods are also provided. That is you can format either:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for a specified locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with a specified locale.

\end{itemize}
\index{get\_instance() (apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.percent\_validator.PercentValidator class method)@\spxentry{get\_instance()}\spxextra{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.percent\_validator.PercentValidator class method}}

\paragraph{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.regex\_validator module}
\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:module-apache_commons_validator_python.routines.regex_validator}}\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache-commons-validator-python-routines-regex-validator-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.regex\_validator@\spxentry{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.regex\_validator}}\index{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.regex\_validator@\spxentry{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.regex\_validator}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Module Name: regex\_validator.py
Description: Translates apache.commons.validator.routines.RegexValidator.java
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Link: \sphinxurl{https://github.com/apache/commons-validator/blob/master/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/RegexValidator.java}
Paraphrased from apache.commons.validator.routines.RegexValidator:

\sphinxAtStartPar
Regular Expression validation (using Python’s built\sphinxhyphen{}in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{re}} module).

\sphinxAtStartPar
Constructs the validator either for a single regular expression or a set (list) of regular expressions.
By default, validation is \sphinxstyleemphasis{case sensitive} but constructors are provided to allow \sphinxstyleemphasis{case\sphinxhyphen{}insensitive} validation.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Example:}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{To create a validator which does case in\sphinxhyphen{}sensitive validation for a set of regular expressions:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textasciigrave{}
regexs = "some\_str"
validator = RegexValidator(regexs, case\_sensitive=False)
\textasciigrave{}}}

\sphinxlineitem{Validate returning a boolean (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{False}}):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textasciigrave{}
valid = validator.is\_valid(some\_value)
\textasciigrave{}}}

\sphinxlineitem{Validate returning an aggregated String of the matched groups:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textasciigrave{}
result = validator.validate(some\_value)
\textasciigrave{}}}

\sphinxlineitem{Validate and return the matched groups as a list of strings:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textasciigrave{}
result = validator.match(some\_value)
\textasciigrave{}}}

\end{description}

\sphinxlineitem{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Patterns are matched against the entire input.

\sphinxlineitem{Thread Safety:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Compiled regex patterns are cached and can be used in multi\sphinxhyphen{}threaded environments safely.

\end{description}
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Author: Juji Lau
License (Taken from apache.commons.validator.routines.RegexValidator):
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one or more
contributor license agreements. See the NOTICE file distributed with
this work for additional information regarding copyright ownership.
The ASF licenses this file to You under the Apache License, Version 2.0
(the “License”); you may not use this file except in compliance with
the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxurl{http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0}
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
distributed under the License is distributed on an “AS IS” BASIS,
WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
limitations under the License.
\end{quote}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Changes:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Java uses the package \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern}} for regular expressions. This Python file uses the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{re}} package.

\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Removed:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{CASE\_SENSITIVE}}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
It was private constant (so no outside code calling).
Instead, we passed \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{case\_sensitive}} as an argument to \_\_init\_\_(), setting it to True by default.

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{toCompileFlags()}}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
We only have one flag to keep track of (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{re.IGNORECASE}}).

\end{description}

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Substitutions (Java \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} Python):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{java.util.regex}}           \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{}  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{re}}                    Regex package
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{regex.compile()}}           \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{}  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{re.compile()}}          Compiles a Pattern
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{regex.Pattern}}             \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{}  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{re.Pattern}}
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern.CASE\_INSENSITIVE}}  \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{}  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{re.INGORECASE}}         Flag to ignore case when pattern matching.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern.pattern}}           \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{}  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern.pattern}}       Field that represents the pattern regex as a string.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern.matcher(value).matches()}}  \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{}  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern.fullmatch(value)}}        Matches the entire value against the pattern.
\begin{quote}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Java:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern.matcher(value)}}    Creates a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Matcher}} object that matches the entire value against the pattern.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{matches()}}                 Returns \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}} iff the entire value matches the regex pattern.

\sphinxlineitem{Python:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern.fullmatch()}}       Creates a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Match}}   object that matches the entire value against the pattern. None if there is no match.

\end{description}
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{regex.Matcher}}             \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{}      \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{re.Match}}          Object created by calling method(s) on \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern}}.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Matcher.groups()}}          \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{}      \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Match.groups()}}    List of all the matches in the string to the pattern regex.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{java.lang.Object.clone()}}  \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{}      \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{copy.copy()}}       For shallow copies

\end{description}

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.abstract_number_validator.AbstractNumberValidator}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AbstractNumberValidator}}}}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Short Validation and Conversion routines.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This validator provides a number of methods for validating/converting a string value
to a short to parse either:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for a specified locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with a specified locale.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Use the is\_valid() method to just validate or one of the validate() methods to
validate and receive a converted short value.

\sphinxAtStartPar
So that the same mechanism used for parsing an input value for validation can be used to format output,
corresponding format() methods are also provided. That is you can format either:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with the default locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using the default format for a specified locale.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
using a specified pattern with a specified locale.

\end{itemize}

\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.time\_validator.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{TimeValidator}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{o}{*}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{strict}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{bool}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{True}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{time\_style}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{int}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{3}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AbstractCalendarValidator}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Time validation and conversion utilities.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This module provides methods to validate and convert string representations
of times into \sphinxtitleref{datetime.time} objects using various parsing formats and locales.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Supported conversions:
\sphinxhyphen{} Default format for the default locale
\sphinxhyphen{} Specified pattern with the default locale
\sphinxhyphen{} Default format for a specified locale
\sphinxhyphen{} Specified pattern with a specified locale

\sphinxAtStartPar
All conversion methods (\sphinxtitleref{validate()}) allow optional specification of time zones.
If this is not provided, the system default will be used.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Alternatively, the \sphinxtitleref{CalendarValidator.adjust\_to\_timezone()} method can be used to adjuat the \sphinxtitleref{tzinfo}
of the \sphinxtitleref{datetime} object afterwards.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Once a value has been successfully converted the following methods can be
used to perform various time comparison checks:

\sphinxAtStartPar
Date comparison methods:
\sphinxhyphen{} \sphinxtitleref{compare\_time(d1, d2)}: Compares the hours, minutes, seconds, and milliseconds of two datettimes.
\sphinxhyphen{} \sphinxtitleref{compare\_seconds(d1, d2)}: Compares the hours, minutes, and seconds of two times.
\sphinxhyphen{} \sphinxtitleref{compare\_minutes(d1, d2)}: Compares hours and minutes of two times.
\sphinxhyphen{} \sphinxtitleref{compare\_hours(d1, d2)}: Compares the hours of two times

\sphinxAtStartPar
Formatting methods mirror parsing options and support:
\sphinxhyphen{} Specified pattern
\sphinxhyphen{} Format for a specified locale
\sphinxhyphen{} Format for the default locale

\index{compare\_time() (apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.time\_validator.TimeValidator method)@\spxentry{compare\_time()}\spxextra{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.time\_validator.TimeValidator method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.time_validator.TimeValidator.compare_time}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{compare\_time}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{value}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{datetime}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{compare}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{datetime}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ int}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Compare two datetime values by absolute time (hour, minute, second, and
microscecond).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{value}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{datetime}}) \textendash{} The first datetime to compare.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{compare}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{datetime}}) \textendash{} The second datetime to compare against.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
0 if the times are equal
\sphinxhyphen{}1 if the time represented by value is less than (earlier) the time of compare.
+1 if the time represented by value is greater than (later) the time of compare.

\end{description}\end{quote}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Changes from Java:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Java compares the \sphinxstyleemphasis{millisecond} of two \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Calendar}} object.
Python’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{datetime}} does not have milliseconds.
The finest unit of time in a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{datetime.time}} is the \sphinxstyleemphasis{microsecond}.
This implementation compares milliseconds to determine the earlier time.

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{validate() (apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.time\_validator.TimeValidator method)@\spxentry{validate()}\spxextra{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.routines.time\_validator.TimeValidator method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.routines:apache_commons_validator_python.routines.time_validator.TimeValidator.validate}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{validate}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{o}{*}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{value}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{pattern}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{p}{|}\DUrole{w}{ }None}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{locale}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{p}{|}\DUrole{w}{ }None}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{time\_zone}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{tzinfo\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{p}{|}\DUrole{w}{ }None}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ datetime\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{p}{|}\DUrole{w}{ }None}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Validates and converts a time string into a datetime object using the
provided pattern, locale, and time zone. The datetime will represent the time
string elapsed since the epoch (year, month, day will be set to 1970, 1, 1
respectively.)
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{value}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The input string to validate.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pattern}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}) \textendash{} The date pattern (e.g., ‘yyyy\sphinxhyphen{}MM\sphinxhyphen{}dd’). If None, a default pattern is used.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{locale}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}) \textendash{} The locale to apply (e.g., ‘en\_US’). If None, the system default is used.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{time\_zone}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tzinfo}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}) \textendash{} The timezone to apply to the resulting datetime. If None, no change is made.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A datetime object representing the time\sphinxhyphen{}string elapsed since the the Epoch, if parsing succeeds.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}} if invalid.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Optional{[}datetime{]}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}
