\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
URL Validation routines.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Behavior of validation is modified by passing in options:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
ALLOW\_2\_SLASHES: {[}FALSE{]}  Allows double ‘/’ characters in the path component.

\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{NO\_FRAGMENT: {[}FALSE{]}  By default fragments are allowed, if this option is included}
\sphinxAtStartPar
then fragments are flagged as illegal.

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{ALLOW\_ALL\_SCHEMES: {[}FALSE{]} By default only http, https, and ftp are considered valid schemes.}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Enabling this option will let any scheme pass validation.

\end{description}

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Originally based in on php script by Debbie Dyer, validation.php v1.2b, Date: 03/07/02,
\sphinxurl{https://javascript.internet.com}. However, this validation now bears little resemblance to the php original.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Example of usage:
Construct a UrlValidator with valid schemes of “http”, and “https”.
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
schemes = \{“http”,”https”\}.
url\_validator = UrlValidator(schemes);
if (url\_validator.is\_valid(”\sphinxurl{ftp://foo.bar.com/}”)):
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
print(“URL is valid”)
\end{quote}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{else:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
print(“URL is invalid”)

\end{description}
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Will return \sphinxtitleref{False}.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{If instead the default constructor is used.}
\sphinxAtStartPar
url\_validator = UrlValidator();
if (url\_validator.is\_valid(”\sphinxurl{ftp://foo.bar.com/}”)):
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
print(“URL is valid”)
\end{quote}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{else:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
print(“URL is invalid”)

\end{description}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Will return \sphinxtitleref{True}.

\sphinxAtStartPar
See “\sphinxurl{http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2396.txt}”
Uniform Resource Identifiers (URI): Generic Syntax

\index{date\_get\_time() (in module apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.datetime\_helpers)@\spxentry{date\_get\_time()}\spxextra{in module apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.datetime\_helpers}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.util:apache_commons_validator_python.util.datetime_helpers.date_get_time}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.datetime\_helpers.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{date\_get\_time}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{dt}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{datetime}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ float}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Python wrapper for Java’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Date.getTime()}} function. Returns the number of
milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT represented by this \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{datetime}}
object.

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Note}
Java’s validator calculates the time since the epoch using a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Date}} object.
However, Java’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Date}} is in the processes of deprecating all references to time fields (e.g. hour, minute, second, etc.).
In this project, even though we substitute python’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{date}} for Java’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Date}},
we will use Python’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{date}} does not store time fields, hence we will be using a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{datetime}} for this.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{dt}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{datetime}}) \textendash{} The Python date to get thet time from.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
00:00 GMT represented by dt.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{fuzzy\_parse() (in module apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.datetime\_helpers)@\spxentry{fuzzy\_parse()}\spxextra{in module apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.datetime\_helpers}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\index{ldml\_to\_strptime\_format() (in module apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.datetime\_helpers)@\spxentry{ldml\_to\_strptime\_format()}\spxextra{in module apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.datetime\_helpers}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.util:apache_commons_validator_python.util.datetime_helpers.ldml_to_strptime_format}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.datetime\_helpers.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ldml\_to\_strptime\_format}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{java\_input}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ str}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Convert a Java SimpleDateFormat pattern into an equivalent Python strftime
pattern.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Steps:}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Scan the input string for substrings like ‘yyyy’, ‘MM’, ‘dd’, etc.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
For each match, look up its replacement in JAVA\_TO\_PY.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Produce a new format string with all tokens swapped out.

\end{enumerate}

\end{description}
\subsubsection*{Example}

\sphinxAtStartPar
java\_fmt = “yyyy\sphinxhyphen{}MM\sphinxhyphen{}dd’T’HH:mm:ss.SSSZ”
returns “\%Y\sphinxhyphen{}\%m\sphinxhyphen{}\%dT\%H:\%M:\%S.\%f\%z”

\sphinxAtStartPar
(Used for testing date, time, and calendar validators.)
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{java\_fmt}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The Java SimpleDateFormat pattern to convert

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The Python string pattern, that when fed into \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{datetime.strftime()}} produces
an equivalent date/time string representation.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

Except there are multiple acceptable “short” strings in Java, but only one acceptable
“short” string in Python. This function aims to mimic Java’s flexibility. Uses the

\index{timezone\_has\_same\_rules() (in module apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.datetime\_helpers)@\spxentry{timezone\_has\_same\_rules()}\spxextra{in module apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.datetime\_helpers}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.util:apache_commons_validator_python.util.datetime_helpers.timezone_has_same_rules}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.datetime\_helpers.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{timezone\_has\_same\_rules}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{val1}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{datetime\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{p}{|}\DUrole{w}{ }tzinfo}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{val2}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{datetime\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{p}{|}\DUrole{w}{ }tzinfo}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ bool}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Wrapper function for java.util.TimeZone.hasSameRules().

\sphinxAtStartPar
Determines if two datetime or tzinfo objects share the same rules for time adjustments,
including the raw UTC offset and daylight saving time rules. This function disregards the
time zone identifier (i.e. the name) and focuses solely on the effective behavior (offset)
of the time zones.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{val1}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Union}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{datetime}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tzinfo}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}) \textendash{} A datetime object (from which the tzinfo is extracted)
or a tzinfo instance representing the first time zone.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{val2}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Union}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{datetime}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tzinfo}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{None}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}) \textendash{} A datetime object or tzinfo instance representing the
second time zone. If None, the function returns False.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}} if the time zones have identical rules (i.e. the same UTC offset at the reference time);
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{False}} otherwise, or if either value does not have tzinfo information.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.digester.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Digester}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{root\_object}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{\DUrole{p}{{[}}\DUrole{s}{\textquotesingle{}ValidatorResources\textquotesingle{}}\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ContentHandler}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Custom SAX\sphinxhyphen{}based XML parser that interprets digester rule files and applies them
to dynamically construct and wire objects such as FormSet, Form, Field, etc.,
based on the XML structure.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class mimics Apache Commons Digester by using SAX parsing combined with
pattern\sphinxhyphen{}based rule interpretation, creating a hierarchy of validation resources.

\paragraph{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.flags module}
\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.util:module-apache_commons_validator_python.util.flags}}\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.util:apache-commons-validator-python-util-flags-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.flags@\spxentry{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.flags}}\index{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.flags@\spxentry{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.flags}!module@\spxentry{module}}

\index{Flags (class in apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.flags)@\spxentry{Flags}\spxextra{class in apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.flags}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.util:apache_commons_validator_python.util.flags.Flags}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.flags.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Flags}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{flags}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{0}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Represents a collection of 64 boolean (on/off) flags.  Individual flags are
represented by powers of 2.  For example, Flag 1 = 1 Flag 2 = 2 Flag 3 = 4 Flag 4 =
8.

\sphinxAtStartPar
or using shift operator to make numbering easier:
Flag 1 = 1 \textless{}\textless{} 0
Flag 2 = 1 \textless{}\textless{} 1
Flag 3 = 1 \textless{}\textless{} 2
Flag 4 = 1 \textless{}\textless{} 3

\sphinxAtStartPar
There cannot be a flag with a value of 3 because that represents Flag 1
and Flag 2 both being on/true.
\index{clear() (apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.flags.Flags method)@\spxentry{clear()}\spxextra{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.flags.Flags method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.util:apache_commons_validator_python.util.flags.Flags.clear}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{clear}}}{}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Turns off all flags.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This is a synonym for \sphinxtitleref{turnOffAll()}

\end{fulllineitems}

\paragraph{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.regex module}
\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.util:module-apache_commons_validator_python.util.regex}}\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python.util:apache-commons-validator-python-util-regex-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.regex@\spxentry{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.regex}}\index{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.regex@\spxentry{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.util.regex}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Module Name: re.py
Description:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Provides a wrapper class for python’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{re}} module, by overriding some of the methods so their
specifications more closely match the corresponding methods in Java’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern}} package.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Used internally in \sphinxtitleref{src/main/routines/regex\_validator.py}, and dependencies.
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Author: Juji Lau
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Substitutions:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Java uses the package \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern}} for regular expressions.
This Python file uses the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{re}} package.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Substitutions (Java \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} Python):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{java.util.regex}}           \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{}  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{re}}                    Regex package
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{regex.compile()}}           \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{}  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{re.compile()}}          Compiles a Pattern
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{regex.Pattern}}             \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{}  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{re.Pattern}}
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern.CASE\_INSENSITIVE}}  \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{}  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{re.INGORECASE}}         Flag to ignore case when pattern matching.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern.pattern}}           \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{}  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern.pattern}}       Field that represents the pattern regex as a string.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern.matcher(value).matches()}}  \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{}  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern.fullmatch(value)}}        Matches the entire value against the pattern.
\begin{quote}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Java:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern.matcher(value)}}    Creates a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Matcher}} object that matches the entire value against the pattern.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{matches()}}                 Returns \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}} iff the entire value matches the regex pattern.

\sphinxlineitem{Python:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern.fullmatch()}}       Creates a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Match}}   object that matches the entire value against the pattern. None if there is no match.

\end{description}
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{regex.Matcher}}             \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{}      \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{re.Match}}          Object created by calling method(s) on \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern}}.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Matcher.groups()}}          \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{}      \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Match.groups()}}    List of all the matches in the string to the pattern regex.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{java.lang.Object.clone()}}  \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{}      \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{copy.copy()}}       For shallow copies

\end{description}

\end{description}

A partial wrapper class for Python’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{re}} module, emulating specific
functionalities in Java’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern}} package.

This class includes only the methods and attributes pertinent to the translation project,
omitting other functionalities of Java’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pattern}} class.

removed.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\index{Arg (class in apache\_commons\_validator\_python.arg\_new)@\spxentry{Arg}\spxextra{class in apache\_commons\_validator\_python.arg\_new}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python:apache_commons_validator_python.arg_new.Arg}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.arg\_new.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Arg}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
A default argument or an argument for a specific validator definition (ex:
required) can be stored to pass into a message as parameters. This can be used in a
pluggable validator for constructing locale sensitive messages by using
\sphinxtitleref{MessageFormat} or an equivalent class.  The resource field can be used to determine
if the value stored in the argument is a value to be retrieved from a locale
sensitive message retrieval system like \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{java.util.PropertyResourceBundle}}. The
resource field defaults to ‘true’.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Instances of this class are configured with an \textless{}arg\textgreater{} xml element.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Taken from apache.commons.validator.Arg;
\index{serializable (apache\_commons\_validator\_python.arg\_new.Arg attribute)@\spxentry{serializable}\spxextra{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.arg\_new.Arg attribute}}

Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This contains the list of pluggable validators to run on a field and any message
information and variables to perform the validations and generate error messages.
Instances of this class are configured with a \textless{}field\textgreater{} xml element.

\sphinxAtStartPar

\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.form\_new.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Form}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This contains a set of validation rules for a form. The information is contained
in a list of \sphinxtitleref{Field} objects. Instances of this class are configured with a \textless{}form\textgreater{}
xml element.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Taken from apache.commons.validator.Form;

\index{validate() (apache\_commons\_validator\_python.form\_new.Form method)@\spxentry{validate()}\spxextra{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.form\_new.Form method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python:apache_commons_validator_python.form_new.Form.validate}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{validate}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{params}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{dict}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{actions}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{dict}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{page}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{int}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{field\_name}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ {\hyperref[\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python:apache_commons_validator_python.validator_results_new.ValidatorResults}]{\sphinxcrossref{ValidatorResults}}}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Validates the fields of the form and returns the validation results.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This method iterates through the form’s fields and validates them based on the provided
\sphinxtitleref{params}, \sphinxtitleref{actions}, and \sphinxtitleref{page} parameters. If a \sphinxtitleref{field\_name} is provided, it validates
only that specific field. Otherwise, it validates all fields in the form that are
relevant for the given page.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{params}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dict}}) \textendash{} A dictionary containing parameters required for validation.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{actions}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dict}}) \textendash{} A dictionary of actions associated with the validation process.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{page}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} The current page number used for validating fields relevant to this page.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{field\_name}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} The specific field to validate. If not provided, all fields
on the current page are validated.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
An object containing the result of the validation process.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python:apache_commons_validator_python.validator_results_new.ValidatorResults}]{\sphinxcrossref{ValidatorResults}}}

\sphinxlineitem{Raises}
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python:apache_commons_validator_python.validator_exception_new.ValidatorException}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ValidatorException}}}}} \textendash{} If the specified \sphinxtitleref{field\_name} does not correspond to a valid field
    in the form.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.form\_set\_new.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{FormSet}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class contains a set of Forms associated with a specific Locale. It supports
operations for managing Forms, Constants, and Locale components (language, country,
variant). It also provides methods for processing Forms, merging FormSets, and
managing their states.

\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.generic\_type\_validator\_new.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{GenericTypeValidator}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
GenericTypeValidator class provides methods to format and validate different
types of data inputs.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Use NumPy data types for byte, double, short, and long from Java version since these
do not exist in Python.
\index{cloneable (apache\_commons\_validator\_python.generic\_type\_validator\_new.GenericTypeValidator attribute)@\spxentry{cloneable}\spxextra{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.generic\_type\_validator\_new.GenericTypeValidator attribute}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python:apache_commons_validator_python.generic_validator_new.GenericValidator}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.generic\_validator\_new.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{GenericValidator}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class contains basic methods for performing validations.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Removed functions for double, long, and short for is\_in\_range (just have one general
is\_in\_range).
\index{is\_blank\_or\_null() (apache\_commons\_validator\_python.generic\_validator\_new.GenericValidator static method)@\spxentry{is\_blank\_or\_null()}\spxextra{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.generic\_validator\_new.GenericValidator static method}}

\index{Msg (class in apache\_commons\_validator\_python.msg\_new)@\spxentry{Msg}\spxextra{class in apache\_commons\_validator\_python.msg\_new}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python:apache_commons_validator_python.msg_new.Msg}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.msg\_new.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Msg}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The Msg class represents a message that can be associated with a \sphinxtitleref{Field} and a
pluggable validator.

\sphinxAtStartPar
It allows customization of the message,
enabling alternative messages to be used instead of the default stored
in the \sphinxtitleref{ValidatorAction}. Instances are configured with a \textless{}msg\textgreater{} XML element.
\index{bundle (apache\_commons\_validator\_python.msg\_new.Msg property)@\spxentry{bundle}\spxextra{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.msg\_new.Msg property}}

\index{ValidatorResources (class in apache\_commons\_validator\_python.validator\_resources\_new)@\spxentry{ValidatorResources}\spxextra{class in apache\_commons\_validator\_python.validator\_resources\_new}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{apache_commons_validator_python:apache_commons_validator_python.validator_resources_new.ValidatorResources}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apache\_commons\_validator\_python.validator\_resources\_new.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ValidatorResources}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{sources}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{List\DUrole{p}{{[}}str\DUrole{p}{{]}}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{p}{|}\DUrole{w}{ }None}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
General purpose class for storing FormSet objects based on their associated
locale.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The xml files being passed in need to match the structure detailed below:
\textless{}form\sphinxhyphen{}validation\textgreater{}
├── \textless{}global\textgreater{}
│   ├── \textless{}validator\textgreater{}
│   │   ├── name (attribute, required)
│   │   ├── classname (attribute, required)
│   │   ├── method (attribute, optional, defaults to ‘validate’)
│   │   ├── methodParams (attribute, optional)
│   │   ├── depends (attribute, optional)
│   │   └── msg (attribute, optional; default error message key)
│   ├── \textless{}constant\textgreater{}
│   │   ├── \textless{}constant\sphinxhyphen{}name\textgreater{} (text, required)
│   │   └── \textless{}constant\sphinxhyphen{}value\textgreater{} (text, required)
│   └── … (multiple \textless{}validator\textgreater{} and \textless{}constant\textgreater{} allowed)
│
├── \textless{}formset\textgreater{}
│   ├── language (attribute, optional)
│   ├── country (attribute, optional)
│   └── \textless{}form\textgreater{}
│       ├── name (attribute, required)
│       └── \textless{}field\textgreater{}
│           ├── property (attribute, required)
│           ├── depends (attribute, optional; comma\sphinxhyphen{}separated validator names)
│           ├── page (attribute, optional; for multi\sphinxhyphen{}page forms)
│           ├── indexedListProperty (attribute, optional)
│           ├── indexedProperty (attribute, optional)
│           ├── key (attribute, optional; alternate for message bundle)
│           ├── \textless{}arg0\textgreater{} to \textless{}arg3\textgreater{} (optional; provides values for messages)
│           │   ├── key (attribute, required)
│           │   ├── name (attribute, optional)
│           │   └── resource (attribute, optional, default true)
│           ├── \textless{}msg\textgreater{} (optional; overrides default validator message)
│           │   ├── name (attribute, required; matches a validator)
│           │   └── key (attribute, required; message key)
│           ├── \textless{}var\textgreater{} (optional; parameter to validator)
│           │   ├── \textless{}var\sphinxhyphen{}name\textgreater{} (text, required)
│           │   └── \textless{}var\sphinxhyphen{}value\textgreater{} (text, required)
│           └── … (multiple \textless{}arg\textgreater{}, \textless{}msg\textgreater{}, \textless{}var\textgreater{} allowed)
│
└── … (multiple \textless{}formset\textgreater{} allowed, one per locale if needed)
